summary: A man discusses the importance of participation in a nation's affairs, criticizing those who do not engage and are tribalistic. He emphasizes that to be served, one must offer desire and intellectual capacity to serve others. He states that in many societies, only a small percentage of people can be considered true citizens and that civic education is crucial for transforming individuals into citizens.
transcript: Idiots who don't want to participate in the affairs of their nation. They think things will just work in and of themselves. Then they are tribalists, and these tribalists, they think that they are only safe with people their tribe. And tribe can mean people from the same culture, same language, same culture. Then they are citizens. Individuals, responsible and know that when you want to be served, you must give those who have the desire and the intellectual capacity to serve you. In many societies, it is only a percentage of people that can't be called citizens, not more than 5%. And if a society wants to grow in the right direction, civic education is what will help the idiot and the tribalist to become a citizen.
